snippet: Jaromir Jagr moved into seventh place in career N.H.L. goals and Martin Brodeur made 29 saves to lead the Devils to a 4-1 win over the host Montreal Canadiens on Tuesday night.
abstract: NHL Roundup; New Jersey Devils beat Montreal Canadiens, 4-1, as star Jaromir Jagr moves up to seventh place in career NHL goals; other hockey news noted.
lead_paragraph: Jaromir Jagr moved into seventh place in career N.H.L. goals and Martin Brodeur made 29 saves to lead the Devils to a 4-1 win over the host Montreal Canadiens on Tuesday night.

headline.main: Jagr Climbs to 7th in Career Goals
headline.print_headline: Jagr Climbs to 7th in Career Goals
